title: fix : update condition to disable submit button
body:
# Description
Update condition to disable submit button

On a submitted record : 
=> the button **submit** is **disable** if **the form is untouched** or  if **one of the required question does not have answer**

On a discarded/pending record:
=> the button submit  is **disable** ONLY if **one of the required question does not have answer**

Closes #2881 

**Type of change**

- Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

**How Has This Been Tested**

- only feedback task submit button

title: fix: Remove current-page event destruction to get correct records
body:
# Description

When we change the status selector from one empty to one with records, the record offset is not correct. Removing the destruction of the `current-page` event in pagination, we can get the correct record offset. 

Closes #2880

title: When going to a page superior than maximum available page, go to first page

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

body:
Now if we go to a page number superior than the maximum page number, the ui stay on that page but does not have any data to show (since there is no record for that page). 
This can happens when : 
- we copy paste a url (for example https://dev.argilla.io/dataset/ff0046f3-5098-40e6-80e1-58945faa185c/annotation-mode?_page=**Change_to_a_big_number**&_status=pending).
- when we are at the last page from any status, do an action from clear/discard/submit and then refresh with F5 (since last merge in dev, we are showing an empty message instead)

body:
When we move from an empty status to an other with records, the record is the same in each page.

Have a dataset with no pending records
Go to discarded (is ok)
Go to pending
Back to discarded (the record is repeated in each page)

title: Allow admin user fetching dataset records with responses for all users

labels.name: area: api
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the Fast API server or REST endpoints

body:
Admin users need to fetch records with all user responses for each record. 

The current endpoint `GET /api/v1/me/dataset/:dataset_id/records` allows returning only data for the connected user.


Get should have a similar admin endpoint `GET /api/v1/dataset/:dataset_id/records` fetching all record responses

The Python client should use this endpoint in order to fetch the whole dataset info.


# Tasks

- [x] Backend: Create a new endpoint used by admins to fetch records with all responses -> #2912 
- [x] Python client: Consume the new endpoint -> f06a0e23afda75632b3b92f1ac8053faa9599b05

title: [DOCS] Update installation setup to include the DB migrations

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: type: documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

body:
The current [installation setup](https://docs.argilla.io/en/latest/getting_started/installation/installation.html#launch-argilla-server) does not contain any reference to the [DB migrations](https://docs.argilla.io/en/latest/getting_started/installation/configurations/user_management.html#prepare-the-database) which is a required step prior to launching argilla using Python.

Refs https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/issues/2875

title: Cannot start Argilla 1.6.0
body:
**Describe the bug**
Argilla fails to start according to instructions

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Follow the [instructions](https://docs.argilla.io/en/latest/getting_started/installation/installation.html) to install Argilla 1.6.0
   I do this in a Python virtual environment and it appears to succeed.
2. I continue following the instructions to retrieve and start the Opensearch Docker container. This appears to work; afterwards `docker container ls` reports to containers running, apparently related to Opensearch.  
   I have also tried the Elasticsearch option, but this results in the same kind of error in step 3.
3. I follow step 3 to launch Argilla Server. This fails, see the error below.

**Expected behavior**
I expect `python -m argilla` to return without an error code, possibly stating a port on the localhost to contact the service on.

**Screenshots**
Not really a screenshot, but the command to launch Argilla Server prints the following output to terminal:

    $ python -m argilla
    INFO:     Started server process [102003]
    INFO:     Waiting for application startup.
    ERROR:    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1963, in _exec_single_context
        self.dialect.do_execute(
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/default.py", line 920, in do_execute
        cursor.execute(statement, parameters)
    sqlite3.OperationalError: no such table: users
    
    The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:
    
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 671, in lifespan
        async with self.lifespan_context(app):
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 566, in __aenter__
        await self._router.startup()
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 648, in startup
        await handler()
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/argilla/server/server.py", line 231, in log_default_user_warning_if_present
        default_user = accounts.get_user_by_username(db, DEFAULT_USERNAME)
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/argilla/server/contexts/accounts.py", line 87, in get_user_by_username
        return db.query(User).filter_by(username=username).first()
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/query.py", line 2743, in first
        return self.limit(1)._iter().first()  # type: ignore
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/query.py", line 2842, in _iter
        result: Union[ScalarResult[_T], Result[_T]] = self.session.execute(
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/session.py", line 2231, in execute
        return self._execute_internal(
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/session.py", line 2126, in _execute_internal
        result: Result[Any] = compile_state_cls.orm_execute_statement(
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/context.py", line 292, in orm_execute_statement
        result = conn.execute(
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1413, in execute
        return meth(
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/sqlalchemy/sql/elements.py", line 483, in _execute_on_connection
        return connection._execute_clauseelement(
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1637, in _execute_clauseelement
        ret = self._execute_context(
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1841, in _execute_context
        return self._exec_single_context(
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1982, in _exec_single_context
        self._handle_dbapi_exception(
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 2339, in _handle_dbapi_exception
        raise sqlalchemy_exception.with_traceback(exc_info[2]) from e
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1963, in _exec_single_context
        self.dialect.do_execute(
      File "/home/tari/argilla/lib/python3.10/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/default.py", line 920, in do_execute
        cursor.execute(statement, parameters)
    sqlalchemy.exc.OperationalError: (sqlite3.OperationalError) no such table: users
    [SQL: SELECT users.id AS users_id, users.first_name AS users_first_name, users.last_name AS users_last_name, users.username AS users_username, users.role AS users_role, users.api_key AS users_api_key, users.password_hash AS users_password_hash, users.inserted_at AS users_inserted_at, users.updated_at AS users_updated_at 
    FROM users 
    WHERE users.username = ?
     LIMIT ? OFFSET ?]
    [parameters: ('argilla', 1, 0)]
    (Background on this error at: https://sqlalche.me/e/20/e3q8)
    
    ERROR:    Application startup failed. Exiting.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Linux (Ubuntu 22.04)
 - Browser: Firefox 112.0.2 (I never get to the stage where the browser is involved)
 - Argilla Version: 1.6.0
 - ElasticSearch Version: 8.5.3
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. argilla:v1.0.0]: N/A

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

```python
another_dataset = FeedbackDataset.from_config("my-dataset-file-or-folder")
```

title: Add record validations
body:
# Description

This PR adds the missing record and response validations. The affected endpoints are:

- `POST /api/v1/datasets/:dataset_id/records` 
- `POST /api/v1/records/:record/reponses` 
- `PUT /api/v1/responses/:response_id`

Also, old tests have been modified to pass the record/response validation successfully. 

Closes [#2834](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/issues/2834)

title: Add `Workspace` class & `list_workspaces`
body:
# Description

This PR has been created on top of #2827 to add a `Workspace` class so that we can easily convert workspace names (human readable format) to workspace IDs (transparent to the user). This is just covering the basic functionality which is to `list_workspaces` to get all the available workspaces for the current user, so that when instantiating `Workspace` we can know whether that workspace exists and is available for the current user or not.

Besides that, the main reason behind this PR is because the `/api/v1` and `/api/v1/me` endpoints expect the workspace ID, not the workspace name, as opposed to the former `/api` (v0) which was using names not IDs.

> :warning: Note that this may be extended in the future to cover all the `Workspace` functionalities provided by Argilla, but for the moment, we're keeping it simple since it's just going to be used for name to ID conversation and workspace validation.

**Type of change**

- [X] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

**How Has This Been Tested**

- [X] Add unit tests for `list_datasets` and `Workspace`

**Checklist**

- [X] I have merged the original branch into my forked branch
- [X] I added relevant documentation
- [X] follows the style guidelines of this project
- [X] I did a self-review of my code
- [X] My changes generate no new warnings
- [X] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works

title: feat : front => allow switch record lists by status
body:
# Description
Allow to swich the record lists regarding the status of the records.
By default, records with `reponses_status === "missing"` are fetched

See #2840 
See #2742  
See #2743 


**Type of change**
- New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

**How Has This Been Tested**

- Only feedback task : when selecting a different status from the filter => the records and the total record are updated. 

IMPORTANT : before fetching new records, the Record model is dropped and then the new records are inserted inside the orm model. This is important to not mess with the order of record to get from vuexorm by components

title: upload data in pandas DataFrame for multilabel classification

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: status: stale
labels.description: Indicates that there is no activity on an issue or pull request

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I tried to upload the data in pandas to huggingFace for manual labeling for the multi-label classification task but found that there is no way to directly set the labeling schema to multi-label classification. My codes are following: 

#argilla=1.6.0, python=3.8, pandas=2.0.1
sample_data = pd.read_csv('sample_data.csv')
dataframe=sample_data['text']
dataframe=pd.DataFrame(dataframe)
dataset_rg = rg.read_pandas(dataframe, task="TextClassification")
label_list=["A","B","C","D","E","F","G"]
settings = rg.TextClassificationSettings(label_schema=label_list)
rg.configure_dataset(name="sample", settings=settings)
rg.log(dataset_rg, "sample",tags=tag)


**Describe the solution you'd like**
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.

Instead of creating records like:
record = rg.TextClassificationRecord(
    text="Hello world, this is me!",
    prediction=[("LABEL1", 0.8), ("LABEL2", 0.2)],
    annotation="LABEL1",
    multi_label=True,
)
It would be useful to add the ‘multi_label’ parameter to the function ‘read_pandas’, ‘TextClassificationSettings’ or ‘configure_dataset’. So that we can achieve the multilabel setting in pandas. For example:

dataset_rg = rg.read_pandas(dataframe, task="TextClassification", multi_label=True )
or
settings = rg.TextClassificationSettings(label_schema=label_list, multi_label=True)
or
rg.configure_dataset(name="sample", settings=settings, multi_label=True)

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

title: Add response_status filter when listing dataset records for an user
body:
# Description

The endpoint `/api/me/v1/datasets/:dataset_id/records` accepts a query param `response_status` to filter by the user responses status. The possible values are:

- `missing`: to find records without responses for the current user.
- `submitted`: to find records with submitted responses for the current user.
- `discarded`: to find records with discarded responses.

*Note: The "pending" state corresponds, for now, to those records without a response for the user requesting them. Once we introduce new intermediate status (like `draft`), the "pending" state may include those intermediate statuses. This is the reason why the current filter is defined as `missing` instead of `pending`.*

Also, the `total` value in the response is computed based on the filter configuration.

Closes https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/issues/2840

cc @leiyre @keithCuniah

title: feat : show toast on navigation when record is in pending state
body:
# Description
When record have been touched (means the form is different than his initial state) and user click on pagination, a toast need to be showned to the user to confirm action and to explain that the current modification will be lost if form is not submitted.

Note: the function which have the responsability to show or not the toast is in PaginationFeedback.component.vue and not Pagination.component.vue to keep the atomic component stupid. Later, when Pagination.component.vue will be reused, it will be more easy to change this callback from his direct parent.

Closes #2836 

**Type of change**

- New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

**How Has This Been Tested**

- Only feedback task

title: fix : submit button disable state synchronisation
body:
# Description
Fix submit button disable state synchronisation => In the previous version it was possible to click on submit even if the form contains some required questions not fullfilled (but an error was showing to the user to show him that some required questions were not fullfilled, so the form could not be submit until that moment). 
Now that this message was removed, the submit button need to be disable to prevent the click until all the required questions are fullfilled.

Also some comments have been made to improve the readability of onSubmit() 

Closes #2849 

**Type of change**

- Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

**How Has This Been Tested**

- Only feedback task

title: Response creation/update must receive a value for status
body:
# Description

**Warning:** review and merge PR https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/pull/2826 before this one.

This PR add changes to record responses so it must receive a value for `status` when they are created or updated.

Related changes:
* Now when a response is created a `status` value is mandatory to be used (previously it was optional with `submitted` as default).
  * This change affects frontend @keithCuniah
* Now response `values` is optional. You can create a response with `status` to `discarded` without specifying a value for `values` field.
  * This change affect database migrations. We need to rollback responses table migration on `dev` environment and running it again after deployment.

This PR affects the following endpoints:
* `GET  /datasets/{dataset_id}/records`
* `POST /datasets/{dataset_id}/records`
* `POST /records/{record_id}/responses`
* `PUT  /responses/{response_id}`

@keithCuniah feel free to add frontend changes if the PR is approved.

Closes #2762

title: Add new `FeedbackDataset` class using `/api/v1` endpoints
body:
## Description

This PR addresses the creation of a new `FeedbackDataset` class to handle the new datasets provided in Argilla. These datasets define some fields and questions for every dataset. The fields are the inputs, while the questions are the "annotations" which in this case correspond to questions over the fields that can either be numerical or textual, so that the annotator has to answer those questions in order to label the data.

This PR closes #2758, and #2764

**Type of change**

- [X] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

**How Has This Been Tested**

- [X] Included unit tests for `/api/v1/datasets` endpoint wrappers
- [X] Included unit tests for `rg.FeedbackDataset` class and any other related method/function

**Checklist**

- [X] I have merged the original branch into my forked branch
- [X] I added relevant documentation
- [X] follows the style guidelines of this project
- [X] I did a self-review of my code
- [X] I made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [X] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] I have added relevant notes to the CHANGELOG.md file (See https://keepachangelog.com/)

## Example

```python
import argilla as rg

rg.init(
    api_url="<ARGILLA_URL_GOES_HERE>",
    api_key="<ARGILLA_API_KEY_GOES_HERE>",
)

dataset = rg.FeedbackDataset(
  guidelines="...",
  fields=[
    rg.TextField(name="prompt", required=True),
    rg.TextField(name="context", required=False),
    rg.TextField(name="completion", required=True),
  ],
  questions=[
    rg.RatingQuestion(name="prompt-quality", title="Assess the quality of the prompt", required=True),
    rg.TextQuestion(name="prompt-edit", title="Edit the prompt if applicable", required=False),
  ]
)

dataset.add_records(records=[
  rg.FeedbackRecord(
    fields={"prompt": ..., "context": ..., "completion": ...}
  ),
])
print(dataset.records[0])
dataset.push_to_argilla(name="my-dataset", workspace="my-workspace")
```

title: Use `/me` prefix for endpoints returning current user contextual response
body:
# Description

This PR include changes adding prefix `/me` to APIv1 endpoints that build the response using current user as context. The behavior of these endpoints has been changed too.

The include changes are:
* `GET` `/api/v1/datasets` changed to `GET` `/api/v1/me/datasets`
  *  The behavior of the endpoint didn't change.
* `GET` `/api/v1/datasets/{dataset_id}/records` changed to `GET` `/api/v1/me/datasets/{dataset_id}/records`
  * The behavior for the endpoint returning record didn't change.
  * The behavior including record responses changed and now it's only including current user record responses (even if you are an admin).
* `GET` `/api/v1/records/{record_id}/responses` has been removed.
  * It wasn't being used by the frontend so I've deleted it for now.
 
@keithCuniah feel free to add the necessary frontend changes to this PR replacing the use of the old endpoints to the new ones according to the previous changes section. Take into account that endpoint `/api/v1/me/datasets/{dataset_id}/records` is now only returning the responses for the current user when `include=response` is used. (Prior to this change the responses for all users where included when using `include=response` and the user doing the request was an admin).

Closes #2823

title: [Docs] remove unused pages
body:
Closes #2566

Hello!

## Pull Request overview
* Remove unused pages (features_all, features_points, missing)
* Fix link to `Setup and Installation` page
* Introduce Unstructured in the list of libraries

## Details
I noticed the following logs when building the docs locally:
```
checking consistency...
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\features_all.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\features_points.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\missing.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\snippets\training\text-classification\autotrain.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\snippets\training\text-classification\setfit.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\snippets\training\text-classification\spacy.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\snippets\training\text-classification\transformers.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\snippets\training\text2text\autotrain.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\snippets\training\token-classification\autotrain.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\snippets\training\token-classification\spacy.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\snippets\training\token-classification\transformers.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\getting_started\installation\installation.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\tutorials\libraries\unstructured.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
``` 

### Removing unused pages
This PR removes `features_all.md`, `features_points.md` and `missing.md`. The last of these three was replaced by [404.rst](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/blob/develop/docs/_source/404.rst). Note that these files could still be found via searching. For example, if I search for "Features", then the first result is:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37621491/235898787-18b16a5a-94b3-42d8-bb79-b3065fc56eca.png)

Which is this page: https://docs.argilla.io/en/latest/_common/features_all.html (i.e. features_all). As you can tell, all of the links on this page are broken.

### Installation
```
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\getting_started\installation\installation.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
```
Because of this PR, you can again find this page via https://docs.argilla.io/en/latest/community/developer_docs.html. The only other way is via searching for it. This does not seem ideal. 

@davidberenstein1957 @nataliaElv Should this file be removed, or should it be placed on the table of contents tree? The current situation (i.e. almost inaccessible except via searcing) doesn't seem ideal.

### Introduce Unstructured in the list of libraries
```
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\tutorials\libraries\unstructured.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
```
Due to this PR, Unstructured will appear in the list here: https://docs.argilla.io/en/latest/tutorials/libraries/libraries.html as well as in the TOC tree on the left under "Libraries".

## After this PR
Now, the list is:
```
checking consistency...
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\snippets\training\text-classification\autotrain.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\snippets\training\text-classification\setfit.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\snippets\training\text-classification\spacy.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\snippets\training\text-classification\transformers.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\snippets\training\text2text\autotrain.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\snippets\training\token-classification\autotrain.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\snippets\training\token-classification\spacy.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\_common\snippets\training\token-classification\transformers.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
C:\code\argilla\docs\_source\getting_started\installation\installation.md: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree
```
Which seems better. The snippets shouldn't be included, so that's right, and the installation page isn't in the TOC yet as mentioned above.

**Type of change**

- [x] Documentation update

**How Has This Been Tested**

N\A

**Checklist**
N\A

- Tom Aarsen

title: Modify endpoints to return contextual current user response using `/me` prefix
body:
We should modify APIv1 endpoints to use `/me` prefix when returning a contextual response for the current user doing the request.

At the same time we should add where necessary additional generic endpoints without the `/me` prefix that will return all the information for the endpoint and that only admins can use.

As an example:
- We will have `/me/datasets/{dataset_id}/records?include=responses` that will return dataset records including responses only for the current user doing the request.
- We will have also `/datasets/{dataset_id}/records?include=responses` that will return dataset records including responses for all users and only admins can use this endpoint. This endpoint will be specially useful for the Python client.

title: Release v1.7.0
body:
## [1.7.0](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/compare/v1.6.0...v1.7.0)

### Added

- add `max_retries` and `num_threads` parameters to `rg.log` to run data logging request concurrently with backoff retry policy. See [#2458](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/issues/2458) and [#2533](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/issues/2533)
- `rg.load` accepts `include_vectors` and `include_metrics` when loading data. Closes [#2398](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/issues/2398)
- Added `settings` param to `prepare_for_training` ([#2689](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/issues/2689))
- Added `prepare_for_training` for `openai` ([#2658](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/issues/2658))
- Added `ArgillaOpenAITrainer` ([#2659](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/issues/2659))
- Added `ArgillaSpanMarkerTrainer` for Named Entity Recognition ([#2693](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/pull/2693))
- Added `ArgillaTrainer` CLI support. Closes ([#2809](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/issues/2809))

### Changed

- Argilla quickstart image dependencies are externalized into `quickstart.requirements.txt`. See [#2666](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/pull/2666)
- bulk endpoints will upsert data when record `id` is present. Closes [#2535](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/issues/2535)
- moved from `click` to `typer` CLI support. Closes ([#2815](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/issues/2815))
- Argilla server docker image is built with PostgreSQL support. Closes [#2686](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/issues/2686)
- The `rg.log` computes all batches and raise an error for all failed batches.
- The default batch size for `rg.log` is now 100.

### Fixed

- `argilla.training` bugfixes and unification ([#2665](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/issues/2665))
- Resolved several small bugs in the `ArgillaTrainer`.

### Deprecated

- The `rg.log_async` function is deprecated and will be removed in next minor release.

body:
Add a loader (simple, not a squeleton component) when fetching record.

When user click on pagination, a latency could appears if the record is not yet in the vuex orm yet. This latency is corresponding to the time to fetch the records (5 records by default) from the corresponding page.

title: add `CLI` support `ArgillaTrainer`

labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I want to use `CLI`!

**Describe the solution you'd like**
```
Usage: python -m argilla.tasks.training [OPTIONS]

  Creates a default training task using CLI commands.

Options:
  -n, --name TEXT              The name of the dataset to be used for
                               training.
  -f, --framework TEXT         Choose a framework: transformers, openai,
                               span_marker, setfit or spacy.
  -w, --workspace TEXT         The workspace to be used for training.
  -l, --limit TEXT             The number of record to be used.
  -q, --query TEXT             The query to be used.
  -m, --model TEXT             The modelname or path to be used for training.
  -t, --train-size FLOAT       The train split to be used.
  -s, --seed INTEGER           The random seed number.
  -d, --device INTEGER         The GPU id to be used for training.
  -o, --output-dir TEXT        Output directory for the saved model.
  --update-config-kwargs TEXT  Output directory for the saved model.
  --api-url TEXT               Api url to be used for training.
  --api-key TEXT               Api key to be used for training.
  --help                       Show this message and exit.
```

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
N.A.

**Additional context**
N.A.

title: feat : navigate with shortcut feedback task

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

body:
# Description
Add shortcuts to actions : 
- **enter** to **submit**
- **suppr** to **discard**
- **arrow-right** to **go to next page**
- **arrow-left** to **go to previous page**

When the text component have focus 
- **shift + enter** : to **submit** 
- **shift + suppr** : to **discard**
- not possible to paginate except if the component loose focus from the text component

Closes #2767 

**WARNING** This break the shortcut **shift + enter** for **Text2Text** classification.

title: [Docs] Replace labelling with labeling

labels.name: type: documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

body:
Closes #2803

# Description

I've replaced `labelling` (2 L's) with `labeling` throughout the documentation. Note that there are still *many* occurrences of `labelling` (2 L's) as many files are named with 2 L's. If we edit these, old links from outside of Argilla pointing to Argilla docs will stop working.
As a result, I left these for now. Perhaps that's something for 2.0? @nataliaElv 

I tried to be careful to not introduce any breaking links.

**Type of change**

- [x] Documentation update

**How Has This Been Tested**

---

- Tom Aarsen

title: [Docs] inconsistent use of labelling and labeling

labels.name: type: documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
In the codebase, `labeling` (the US spelling) is used exclusively, while the documentation uses both `labeling` and `labelling`. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I think it would be best to normalize it all to `labeling`, i.e. matching the spelling in the codebase.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
We could also normalize to `labelling`, i.e the UK spelling, but I think that clashes with the codebase too much. 

**Additional context**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37621491/235082920-80a7cc81-9525-4573-8dc7-b1b7f40bde37.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37621491/235082961-b6372f52-c029-4c7a-87a8-5b74ac6a89bf.png)

- Tom Aarsen

title: Fix delete datasets with cascade deletion
body:
# Description

There was a bug on the backend detected by @keithCuniah when a dataset with related questions is deleted giving a database error.

This was caused by SQLAlchemy default behavior trying to delete explicitly relationships rows one by one.

This default behavior can be changed setting `passive_deletes=True` on the defined model relationship. Meaning that the deletion will not be done and it will be managed by the database (if available).

title: Add responses status and set it as submitted after creation
body:
# Description

This PR modifies responses creation table migration adding a new `status` column. The `status` column will have a default value of `submitted` set by the `Response` SQLAlchemy model.

Later we can add more logic to set different statuses like `discarded`.


Closes #2790

title: Add maximum character length limit to text fields
body:
We need to review all the APIv1 fields that are accepting textual information and set a limitation in the number of characters that they accept in the creation.

We should set a limit of characters that has sense inside the context of the field itself.

Some of the fields are:
* `datasets.guidelines`: we should set a big limitation to allow a complete document.
* `questions.description`: we should set a smaller limitation something in the 5.000 character or similar.

It's possible that we have more fields like these ones. We need to review and add a limitation to all of them.
